mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.103:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
an5.103:1.1.en: “Mendicants, a master thief with five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

an5.103:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca, balavanissito ca, bhogacāgī ca, ekacārī ca.
an5.103:1.3.en: A master thief relies on rough ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals; they pay bribes, and they act alone.

an5.103:2.1.en: And how does a master thief rely on rough ground?

an5.103:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro nadīviduggaṁ vā nissito hoti pabbatavisamaṁ vā.
an5.103:2.2.en: It’s when a master thief relies on inaccessible riverlands or rugged mountains.

an5.103:2.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti.
an5.103:2.3.en: That’s how a master thief relies on rough ground.

an5.103:3.1.en: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?

an5.103:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṁ vā nissito hoti rukkhagahanaṁ vā rodhaṁ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṁ vā.
an5.103:3.2.en: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a blind spot, or a large forest grove.

an5.103:3.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti.
an5.103:3.3.en: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.

an5.103:4.1.en: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?

an5.103:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṁ vā rājamahāmattānaṁ vā nissito hoti.
an5.103:4.2.en: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their chief ministers.

an5.103:4.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti.
an5.103:4.6.en: That’s how a master thief relies on powerful individuals.

an5.103:5.1.en: And how does a master thief pay bribes?

an5.103:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo.
an5.103:5.2.en: It’s when a master thief is rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an5.103:5.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro bhogacāgī hoti.
an5.103:5.6.en: That’s how a master thief pays bribes.

an5.103:6.1.en: And how does a master thief act alone?

an5.103:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro ekakova gahaṇāni kattā hoti.
an5.103:6.2.en: It’s when a master thief carries out robbery all alone.

an5.103:6.5.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro ekacārī hoti.
an5.103:6.5.en: That’s how a master thief acts alone.

an5.103:7.1.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati nillopampi harati ekāgārikampi karoti paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
an5.103:7.1.en: A master thief with these five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.103
11. Living Comfortably
A Master Thief

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an3.50:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
an3.50:1.1.en: “Mendicants, a master thief with three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

an3.50:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca hoti, balavanissito ca hoti.
an3.50:1.3.en: A master thief relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.

an3.50:1.4.en: And how does a master thief rely on uneven ground?

an3.50:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro nadīviduggaṁ vā nissito hoti pabbatavisamaṁ vā.
an3.50:1.5.en: It’s when a master thief relies on inaccessible riverlands or rugged mountains.

an3.50:1.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti.
an3.50:1.6.en: That’s how a master thief relies on uneven ground.

an3.50:2.1.en: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?

an3.50:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṁ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṁ vā rodhaṁ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṁ vā.
an3.50:2.2.en: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a blind spot, or a large forest grove.

an3.50:2.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti.
an3.50:2.3.en: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.

an3.50:3.1.en: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?

an3.50:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṁ vā rājamahāmattānaṁ vā nissito hoti.
an3.50:3.2.en: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their chief ministers.

an3.50:3.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti.
an3.50:3.6.en: That’s how a master thief relies on powerful individuals.

an3.50:3.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
an3.50:3.7.en: A master thief with these three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 3.50
5. The Lesser Chapter
A Master Thief

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an8.84:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro khippaṁ pariyāpajjati, na ciraṭṭhitiko hoti.
an8.84:1.1.en: “Mendicants, a master thief with eight factors is soon executed, and doesn’t have long to live.

an8.84:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro khippaṁ pariyāpajjati, na ciraṭṭhitiko hoti.
an8.84:1.4.en: A master thief with these eight factors is soon executed, and doesn’t have long to live.

an8.84:2.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro na khippaṁ pariyāpajjati, ciraṭṭhitiko hoti.
an8.84:2.1.en: A master thief with eight factors is not soon executed, and lives long.

an8.84:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro na khippaṁ pariyāpajjati, ciraṭṭhitiko hotī”ti.
an8.84:2.4.en: A master thief with these eight factors is not soon executed, and lives long.”

sn9.14:2.4.en: Good fellow, you are a thief of scent!”

sn9.14:3.4.en: do you call me a thief of scent?

an7.63:4.3.pli: Vadhakasamā, corīsamā, ayyasamā, mātāsamā, bhaginīsamā, sakhīsamā, dāsīsamā.
an7.63:4.3.en: A wife like a killer, a wife like a thief, a wife like a lord, a wife like a mother, a wife like a sister, a wife like a friend, and a wife like a bondservant.

an7.63:6.5.en: is called a wife and a thief.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7.63
6. The Undeclared Points
Kinds of Wives

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn12.70:27.2.pli: “accayo maṁ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yvāhaṁ evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye dhammatthenako pabbajito.
sn12.70:27.2.en: “I have made a mistake, sir. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of me to go forth as a thief in such a well-explained teaching and training.

sn12.70:28.1.pli: “Taggha tvaṁ, susima, accayo accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yo tvaṁ evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye dhammatthenako pabbajito.
sn12.70:28.1.en: “Indeed, Susīma, you made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of you to go forth as a thief in such a well-explained teaching and training.

sn12.70:29.2.pli: Yā evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye dhammatthenakassa pabbajjā, ayaṁ tato dukkhavipākatarā ca kaṭukavipākatarā ca, api ca vinipātāya saṁvattati.
sn12.70:29.2.en: going forth as a thief in such a well-explained teaching and training has a more painful and bitter result. And it even leads to the underworld.

mlDocs.title:

7. The Great Chapter
The Wanderer Susīma

an5.137:1.5.pli: Coro, bhikkhave, ādānādhippāyo appaṁ rattiyā supati, bahuṁ jaggati.
an5.137:1.5.en: A thief longing for their loot.

kp8:9.2.en: no thief makes off with your savings.
